Summary

  • X.500 Directory tackled global-scale naming head-on

    This drove its naming standards,
    and contributed to its lack of global success

  • LDAP began as X.500 access protocol

    But now LDAP-based directory service is being applied to a different problem: system management;
    this drives its object representation and naming

  • LDAP has internal namespace-scaling issues, too

    Regarding schema standardization, references,
    and use of ASN.1 OIDs vs strings for naming protocol elements
